snippet: Avigdor Lieberman pleaded not guilty to charges of fraud and breach of trust in a criminal case that leaves his political future hanging in the balance.
abstract: Avigdor Lieberman, Israel's former foreign minister, pleads not guilty to charges of fraud and breach of trust in a criminal case that leaves his political future hanging in the balance; says he intends to clear his name and return to Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu's cabinet, preferably as foreign minister.
lead_paragraph: Avigdor Lieberman pleaded not guilty to charges of fraud and breach of trust in a criminal case that leaves his political future hanging in the balance.

headline.seo: Lieberman Pleads Not Guilty in Israeli Fraud Case
headline.main: Former Israeli Foreign Minister Pleads Not Guilty in Fraud Case
headline.print_headline: Former Israeli Foreign Minister Pleads Not Guilty in Fraud Case
